faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: €399,000. This 3-bedroom villa represents premium specification at 40% less than comparable Spanish island markets. The €3,325 per m² price reflects excellent value for the Lo Romero Golf location and quality construction. No additional fees beyond standard Spanish property purchase costs apply to this price.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-Spanish citizens have identical property purchase rights as Spanish nationals. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and should engage a Spanish solicitor to navigate legal requirements. The process typically takes 2-3 months from offer to completion, with straightforward documentation for UK and EU buyers.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €399,000 purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% additional costs: 6-7% transfer tax (depending on region), 1-2% notary and registration fees, and 1-2% solicitor fees. Total costs on this property would be approximately €32,000-40,000. Additional ongoing costs include annual property tax (approximately €300-500) and community fees where applicable.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment destination with 8% year-on-year appreciation, established international communities, and proven rental appeal. Pilar de La Horadada specifically offers authentic Spanish living without overdevelopment, quality healthcare and education infrastructure, and beaches within 20 minutes. Property prices remain 40% below comparable Spanish islands, providing outstanding value.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value compared to UK living. Supermarket shopping costs 30-40% less than UK prices, restaurant meals range €12-25 for quality dining, and utilities (electricity, water, internet) typically cost €100-150 monthly. Healthcare is subsidized through Spanish system contributions. Overall, families report 30-40% cost savings versus comparable UK towns.

faqs.question: Heb ik een visum nodig om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchasing property doesn't require a visa for UK citizens, though you'll need an NIE (Spanish tax number). If planning to reside permanently, UK citizens currently enjoy visa-free residency through Brexit agreements. You should register with local authorities upon residence. For extended stays or residency, consult Spanish embassy guidelines in your country.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is 65 kilometers from Pilar de La Horadada—approximately 1 hour drive. Direct flights to UK airports run 2-2.5 hours flight time. Budget airlines offer frequent connections to London, Manchester, and regional airports, typically €40-100 return. Weekend trips to UK are entirely feasible, making this ideal for families maintaining UK connections.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine with Mediterranean climate: mild winters averaging 15°C (rarely freezing) and warm summers around 28°C. This climate suits year-round outdoor activities—families enjoy beach visits December through October, with September-May offering ideal temperatures without summer heat intensity. Rainfall averages 30-40 rainy days annually.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages through major banks and building societies. Typical terms offer 80% loan-to-value for 20-30 years. UK banks also offer international mortgages. Interest rates currently range 3.5-4.5%. You'll need employment proof or pension documentation, plus property valuation. Many families use equity release from UK property instead.
